newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil March car output up 15.75 pct - Anfavea.
newsitem.headline: Brazil March car output up 15.75 pct - Anfavea.

text.p: Brazil produced 172,476 vehicles in March, up 15.75 percent over the same month last year, Brazil's Motor Manufacturers Association (Anfavea) said.
A spokeswoman for Anfavea said March production was also 13.43 percent higher over February 1997, when 152,049 vehicles were produced.
In the first three months of the year, Brazil produced 460,955 vehicles, up 17.74 percent over the same period last year, she said.
Last month, automakers sold 144,013 vehicles in Brazil, 12.71 percent more than the 127,775 vehicles sold in March 1996, she said.
March sales also rose 13.86 percent when compared to the previous month when 126,486 vehicles were sold in the domestic market, she said.
Brazil vehicle exports jumped to 32,064 vehicles last month, 31.37 percent over exports in March 1996, which were 23,038 vehicles, she added.
